conclusion: Calculate both the average velocity and the average speed of the particle.
The particle moves along two semi-circular arcs: from A to B and from B to C, each with radius 1m.
The distance traveled along each semi-circular arc is half the circumference of a circle with radius R.
The circumference of a full circle is given by C = 2πR.
The length of one semi-circular arc is πR.
The total distance traveled by the particle is 2πR.
Substituting R = 1m, the total distance is 2π m.
Average speed is defined as the total distance traveled divided by the total time taken.
Average velocity is defined as the displacement divided by the total time taken.
A, B, and C are collinear, and the distance from A to C is twice the radius of the arcs.
The displacement from A to C is 2m.
The direction of the displacement is directly from A to C, which is eastward.
The average velocity is 2/5 m/s eastward.
Final Answer: Average Speed: 2π/5 m/s, Average Velocity: 2/5 m/s eastward.
